column2: Yes. Any person entitled to use and occupy the property or to enjoy
its usufruct as of right would be the owner for revenue purposes.
No.  Claiming  the  depreciation  allowance  will  not  give  rise  to  an
inference of ownership, particularly when it is improperly claimed.
As agreed between the parties, an answer is not required.
As agreed between the parties, an answer is not required.
